examples: The driver of the car opened the car door for the passengers.
The waiter opened the bottle of wine for the guests.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
right on cue the door opened
The store stays open late on Thursdays.
words.defineEn: to move something like a window or door into a position that people, things, etc. can pass through
words.defineVi: di chuyển thứ gì đó như cửa sổ hoặc cửa ra vào vào vị trí mà mọi người, đồ vật, v.v. có thể đi qua

examples: The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
The police closed in.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
The library closes early on Sundays.
words.defineEn: to move something like a window or door into a position that people or things cannot pass through
words.defineVi: để di chuyển một cái gì đó như cửa sổ hoặc cửa ra vào một vị trí mà mọi người hoặc những thứ không thể đi qua

examples: If the child doesn't get what he wants, he immediately turns on the waterworks.
The closet had a light that automatically turned on when the door was opened.
I accidentally spilled water on my laptop, and now it won't turn on.
I turned on the air conditioner because it was getting too hot inside.
"Turn on?"
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to operate, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: để làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc xoay chìa khóa

examples: He reached over and turned off his bedside light.
Jill must have been in another world when I asked her to turn off the oven because the bread is burned now.
"Turn off?"
Once inside, he turned off the security alarm.
Don't turn off the captions.
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to stop operating, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị ngừng hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc vặn chìa khóa

examples: The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
A couple of years in the army should make a man of him.
Good wine can make a meal.
The news really made my day.
words.defineEn: to form, produce, or prepare something, by putting parts together or by combining materials
words.defineVi: để hình thành, sản xuất hoặc chuẩn bị một cái gì đó, bằng cách đặt các bộ phận lại với nhau hoặc bằng cách kết hợp các vật liệu

examples: The tax increase sounded the death knell for the business.
He sounds about as much fun as a wet weekend in Carmarthenshire.
The bell sounded for dinner.
A cup of tea sounds perfect.
Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
words.defineVi: bất cứ điều gì mà chúng ta có thể nghe thấy

examples: Pleasurable experiences flush certain parts of our brain with dopamine, a neurotransmitter.
They have flushed the toilet.
I flushed blindly
Putting the lid down before you flush prevents the dreaded toilet plume!
The destroyed cells are flushed from the body in urine.
words.defineEn: to press or pull something so that water would pass through a toilet to clean it
words.defineVi: nhấn hoặc kéo thứ gì đó để nước chảy qua bồn cầu để làm sạch nó

examples: Nobody lives in that house since old Roger popped his clogs.
The roads are clogged with evacuees.
A clog near the eye can cause vision problems and retinal detachment.
And makeup doesn't clog?
Otherwise our courts would be clogged with policy debates.
words.defineEn: to make it so that nothing can move through something
words.defineVi: để làm cho nó để không có gì có thể di chuyển qua một cái gì đó
